review_blob: This beer is a cracker but not if you dont like piney IPAs. Its not a dry IPA its malty and has some balancing but not cloying sweetness from caramel malts, which balances the relatively high bittering. Lots of flavour big piney resiny notes combined with tropical fruits. Solid IPA.

Sorry but this tastes like a xxxx gold with a hint of hop aroma, its nice enough but should not be called an IPA its really light on the IBUs as well as flavour. Like the name, wanted to like the beer but feel like it was more a light pale ale and was a bit of a let down.

Massive aroma, body and flavor. Good body, red amber malts. Its bitter but it has a full bodied malty sweetness to balance it. Its big on the pine and resin and balanced beautifully with fruity hops. Such a powerhouse of flavor that not everyone will find appealing but its made by a hop master and as nice to smell as it is to taste.
Very thin and has an off astringency that detracts from the nice hop aroma. Best thing about it is the clarity but that doesnt help the average taste any.
